website_summaries.verdict: Looking sharp while lifting heavy won't be a problem when you're wearing the Inov-8 FastLift 360. It is made with a TPU heel that is sturdy and doesn't compress even when the person is lifting heavy. The sticky rubber outsole ensures that your feet are firmly planted when doing deadlifts, squats, or powercleans.Meanwhile, the top is crafted using mesh, allowing the interior to remain fresh even when the situation gets intense. The External Heel Cage and the single midfoot strap secures the foot, preventing unwanted movement when you're lifting heavy. It comes highly recommended for people who are serious about weight training.
pros: Almost all of the owners praise the Inov-8 FastLift 360 because of how stable they feel when they are lifting
Tons of wearers love how grippy this trainer is on gym floors
Many reviewers have stated that this pair of Inov-8 training shoes is very durable
Numerous users appreciate the breathability of the top
The military vibes of this model appeal to a lot of shoppers
cons: Some people think that the FastLift 360 is too tight
Those who are not used to wearing weightlifting shoes find this trainer to be too stiff

customer_reviews.title: Beware sizing!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered an 11.5 WIDE and received 11.5 regular. The product page showed 11.5 Wide when ordering, but the cart said 11.5 regular. Finally went to mfgr website, they don't even make a wide size, so this is a goof-up on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Inov-8 knows how to make an athlete shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Product was bought for my husband after he saw how much I loved mine and his stop brand didn’t last more than a year after falling apart and being a heavy shoe compared to this brand. These are used for Olympic lifts. Inov-8 never lets us down. All of their shoes are made as intended and if you have plantar fasciitis this is the brand to try and stick with even after you heal. Best support all around and I’ve tried many shoes. Give their running/cross trainers a try too. Best color variety as well.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for squat days. This brand knows how to make a good shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Esty Downes

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Do what they are suppose to do. Squatting and deadlifting feel great in them. As well as OLY lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Remington

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but you’ll pay
customer_reviews.text: Great high quality lifting shoe, probably a tad overpriced for the market.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Henritze

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The images displayed did justice to the product, no surprises.
customer_reviews.author: SHoward

customer_reviews.title: Great for working out.
customer_reviews.text: Inov-8's Fastlift Sneakers are made from woven-canvas like fabric and rubber. The sneakers are well constructed overall and feel robust. The sneakers have stiffer than average soles with a wide and stable base. They are ideal for deadlifts and other weight lifting exercises where you need a stable base. These are definitely not running shoes, but they work fine for HIIT type exercise routines. They are very supportive around the ankle and well cushioned. In a size 12.5 they fit my husband's long and narrow feet well. He usually wear a size 13 sneaker and these fit fine. All in all... great weight lifting sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Pantliano

customer_reviews.title: Made for lifting
customer_reviews.text: These are really in my opinion made for lifting, deadlifts etc. These do not really flex much when you walk so they are not designed for much other than weightlifting/deadlifts. These keep your feet flat and stable on the ground so you don't injure yourself. They fit a bit snug as they should but not tight where they are uncomfortable. They have laces as well as additional velcro strap to keep your foot from moving. The color is a little more green in person but no big deal. They are made well and should hold up. Again they aren't for regular average wear like sneakers, these are designed for weightlifting.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Lifting Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am so absolutely impressed with these shoes and their performance! Are they a bit pricey? Yes but, they are well worth the money. I couldn’t believe the difference between these shoes and the other shoes that I have worn while lifting. I could immediately feel the sturdiness and balancing that they gave me. The solid foundation that they gave me was astounding and definitely keeps me safer in the gym while wearing these particular shoes. Definitely worth having. I would absolutely recommend these lifting shoes to my fellow lifters.
customer_reviews.author: Impossible Honey

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sticky, but ugly.
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable, and light. The toe area is a little tight for a large foot like mine, but not too bad. The most important part about these is the sole, they are very sticky and stay put on just about any surface. So sticky I almost broke my ankle, jk. But seriously, you have to watch how you move sometimes, you might just end up tripping yourself up. The only thing I really don't like is the color. It looks alright online but in person, it's not so great.
customer_reviews.author: Will4Real

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are way too stiff to be comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: These shoes might be better suited to the Military as they have a camo look to them, but they are sooo stiff your feet can't move in them at all. Even though they fit my feet just fine, they are so stiff there is no flexibility to them so you can't keep them on for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Listed as running shoe when I ordered...definitely not for running
customer_reviews.text: I’m not really sure how to rate this product. When ordering, the description read “running, training and lifting”. Now the description reads “lifting” shoe. I ordered these for my husband as a running shoe. These are not comfortable enough for running. However, they look really nice and would work really well for lifting. I’ll give it 4 stars since I was unable to fully review it based on the varying descriptions listed.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S.

customer_reviews.title: Built to Last
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers fit me perfectly. Though they're not the most comfortable sneakers I have ever worn, they are among the best-constructed. They're incredibly tough over every inch of the sneaker - very strong materials that will last for years. I tossed a couple of standard insoles into them and they feel great. They're holding up very, very well to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Matt and Jessi

customer_reviews.title: strong heel support, nice design.
customer_reviews.text: i like the way these fit, but a little disappointed in the fit. i am a 10.5 and the 10.5 i received fit more like a 10 on my foot, tight in the toe. i do like how strong on the heel i felt when moving around in them, even loose i didn't question my footing. nice shoe, just go a half size up when ordering..
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Side Up

customer_reviews.title: A lot of solid support
customer_reviews.text: These have a lot of solid support for weight lifting. They are also extremely comfortable. They are not the most attractive shoes, but they do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: samiam

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: These are so well made, so comfortable! They're great for lifting, yes - and they're also great for everyday casual wear. Feel like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Oliver DeMille, TJEd

customer_reviews.title: It’s very firm on the feet and under the foot
customer_reviews.text: This she is really firm fits snugly and very comfortable , doesn’t flex or shift when lifting heavy, got a very snotty look
customer_reviews.author: RenJ

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Was not impressed with these. They are quite uncomfortable - not too tight or loose, just uncomfy.
customer_reviews.author: Smartly Created

product_meta.title: inov-8 Inov8 Fastlift 360 Training Shoes - AW20
product_meta.description: Inov8 Fastlift Gamma 360 Training Shoes Offering stability and flexibility the Inov8 Fastlift 360 Training Shoes is ideal for high powered lifting and functional training. Inov8 Shoe Fit Scale For technical footwear, a good fit is essential to enhance your performance. Inov8's new Shoe Fit Scale makes it easier to find the perfect fitting shoe. All Inov8 shoes are designed with Met-Cradle technology to lock down the mid-foot for a stable hold, where they differ is in the toe box. The shoes are now graded from 1 to 5, Grade 1 representing their closest, most precise fit and Grade 5 representing the widest fitting toe box. The lower the number on the scale, the narrower the fit, which ensures minimal internal movement of the foot when running fast on technical terrain. Shoes with the higher numbers on the scale will suit athletes with a wider foot and those wanting that extra comfort in the toe box. This wider toe box allows the toes to splay for increased stability when lifting heavy weights. It's also perfect for longer runs and races when toes begin to swell. Inov8 have graded the Fastlift Gamma 360 Training Shoes as Grade 4. Protective Upper Constrcuted using a super-durable yet flexible material, the upper of Inov8 Fastlift 360 Training Shoes offers added protection whilst still allowing the foot to flex naturally. The upper works to protect your feet from knocks and bangs and remains super durable so you can use it time and time again. It also allows for freedom of movement so you can lift and squat with comfort and ease. Additionally, the fabrication also features perforations which increase airflow to keep your feet cool, dry and comfortable at all times. The increase in airflow creates a perfect microclimate for your feet to thrive in and reduces an uncomfortable heat build-up. Ballistic nylon overlays have also been used on the upper to provide support and structure as well as increased durability. As well as this, the heel features an External
feature_bullets: Protective Upper - Protects your feet whilst offering added flexibility.
Preforations - Delivers ventilation to the wearer during intense sessions.
Ballistic Nylon Overlays - Provides added durability for long lasting wear.
External Heel Cage - Increases structure around the heel.
Lacing System - Locks down the midfoot.
